title: Smashed Cucumbers with Tingly Granola
ingredients: - 2 pounds Persian cucumbers (about 12) or 2 English cucumbers, ends trimmed
- 1 teaspoon Mushroom Seasoning Powder, homemade or store-bought
- 1 cup roughly chopped cilantro leaves and stems
directions: 1. If using English cucumbers, halve them lengthwise; leave Persian cucumbers whole.
2. Place cucumbers on a work surface (cut-side down if halved). Lay the flat of a chef’s knife blade on the cucumbers and whack firmly with the heel of your palm to slightly flatten.
3. Chop or tear the smashed cucumbers into 1-inch pieces.
4. In a medium mixing bowl, toss the cucumbers with salt and mushroom seasoning powder.
5. Let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes or refrigerate up to 24 hours to cure.
6. Drain the cucumbers and add cilantro, garlic, vinegar, sesame seeds, gochugaru, and sugar.
7. Stir well and transfer to a serving plate.
